DOC.HEAD: Police Arrest 118, Including Three Celebrities, In Salvador Protest
DOC.TEXT: Police arrested 118 people including musicians Kris Kristofferson and Jackson Browne and actor Martin Sheen at a demonstration Wednesday against U.S. support for El Salvador's rightist government. Those arrested were among 500 demonstrators outside the downtown federal building, where protesters have since mid-November gathered each Wednesday morning to block entrances. ``I'm opposed to U.S. military aid to the (Alfredo) Cristiani government, a right-wing terror-death squad government. It has been going on for a long time,'' said Kristofferson as he sat down in front of the building. Also sitting with Kristofferson was Sheen, who has been arrested at previous demonstrations at the building. Browne was part of a group that briefly got into a shoving match with police when the group briefly blocked a federal police parking lot nearby, but returned to the federal building. ``We decided not to be arrested there because we would be arrested by city police and separated from the group,'' Browne explained. The building and its perimeter are under the jurisdiction of U.S. Protective Service police. Demonstrators are arrested for blocking access to a federal building, a $25 infraction. The demonstrations began after leftist rebels began a series of attacks against the Cristiani government beginning in mid-November. Those incidents have dwindled in recent weeks.
